title: imphal News
content: Manipur Police have formed a special anti-extortion cell to counter the rise in extortion by underground groups and gangs since May 2023. Led by the ADGP (Law and Order), the cell will oversee crack teams targeting extortion hotspots. Over 121 extortionists have been arrested with efforts focused on protecting businesses and essential commodity transport.

title: ghaziabad News
content: Despite significant reductions in farm fires, the Commission for Air Quality Management warns that overaged vehicles in Delhi and NCR exacerbate pollution. Delhi, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh show inadequate efforts in phasing out such vehicles. Enhancing public transport and e-mobility infrastructure is urgently needed. An FIR has been filed against Alt News co-founder Mohammad Zubair for allegedly inciting protests against Dasna Devi temple priest Yati Narsinghanand. Zubair's posts allegedly led to a demonstration, prompting police to impose prohibitory orders. The charges against Zubair include promoting enmity and defamation. Ten protesters were arrested amid heightened security and tension in Ghaziabad. Ghaziabad police arrested a 19-year-old after a gunfight for allegedly raping a 7-year-old girl during a Ramlila event in Nandgram. The youth had taken the girl on the pretext of buying ice cream. He assaulted her and threatened to kill her. The victim was later found unconscious with injuries and is currently receiving care at home. Trial runs have commenced for the Namo Bharat train on the 12km Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut RRTS corridor segment from Sahibabad to New Ashok Nagar. With three new Delhi stations nearing completion and advanced evaluations planned, this infrastructure boosts commuter convenience, integrating multiple transit modes. The entire 82km corridor is expected to be operational by June 2025.

title: faridabad News
content: The central government will implement an online system to detect older diesel and petrol vehicles on Delhi roads by Diwali. Utilizing FASTag data and the Vahan database, authorities will identify and e-challan vehicles without valid fitness and pollution certificates. Initially, this will target vehicles at Delhi’s 52 entry points and may expand nationwide. Despite significant reductions in farm fires, the Commission for Air Quality Management warns that overaged vehicles in Delhi and NCR exacerbate pollution. Delhi, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh show inadequate efforts in phasing out such vehicles. Enhancing public transport and e-mobility infrastructure is urgently needed. Delhi's air quality deteriorated with an AQI of 292, approaching 'very poor' levels. Key pollutants include PM10 and PM2.5, mainly from transportation. Neighbouring regions also contribute significantly to the pollution. Expected further worsening due to unfavorable meteorological conditions and additional emissions from stubble burning. BJP won 5 out of 6 seats in Faridabad, with key victories in constituencies like Tigaon and Badkhal. Civic issues were a major concern during the campaign, but efforts by Amit Shah and Yogi Adityanath aided BJP's success. Congress won only one seat in Prithla. Rahul Gandhi's farmer-focused campaign failed to resonate with the urban electorate.

title: erode News
content: Chennai experienced heavy rains as the northeast monsoon set in, with 12cm recorded in Nungambakkam. IMD issued a red alert predicting extremely heavy rainfall in multiple districts. On Thursday, a depression is expected to cross near Chennai, bringing winds of 35-55 kmph. Some areas like Puzhal recorded up to 16cm of rainfall. Stay prepared for floods by gathering emergency supplies, following updates, and unplugging appliances during outages. Adhere to evacuation orders, ensure pets' safety, and avoid venturing into flood-prone areas. Practice health precautions like frequent hand washing, boiling drinking water, and avoiding outside food. Maintain electrical safety by checking wiring and avoiding wet switches or power cables. Governor R N Ravi faced backlash for omitting 'Dravida' from Tamil Thaai Vaazhthu during a Hindi event, igniting criticism from various political leaders. Participating in Tamil University’s convocation, Ravi stood up for the original version. Leaders accused him of creating controversies for attention, while discussions on language policies and spirituality in politics ensued. The India Meteorological Department forecasts the onset of the northeast monsoon over southeast India around Oct 15-16, with Chennai and neighboring districts expected to receive significant rainfall. An orange alert has been issued for Oct 15-16, predicting 6cm-20cm of rain due to a low-pressure area forming over the Bay of Bengal.

title: cuttack News
content: The Odisha state government plans to install statues of 21 eminent personalities, including a 150-ft statue of tribal leader Birsa Munda as part of a mega memorial park in Sundargarh. Other notable figures include Swami Laxmanananda Saraswati, Atal Bihari Vajpayee, and several tribal freedom fighters.

title: chandigarh News
content: Har Vilas, a commission agent, was fatally shot by two attackers in Ismailabad village while driving. The police suggest the motive could be an old rivalry. Efforts are ongoing to apprehend the culprits. The local Commission Agents Association demands increased police presence during the paddy procurement season to ensure agents' safety.

Avinash Mishra is making headlines for his abrupt exit from Bigg Boss 18. Housemates collectively decided to vote the actor out after his aggressive fight with fellow contestant Chum Darang. Over the years, the actor has made headlines several times. Here’s all that you need to know about him:- Avinash Mishra is an emerging Indian television actor known for his versatile performances and charming presence on screen. He made his acting debut in 2017 with the series Sethji, where he portrayed the character Bajirao, quickly gaining recognition for his talent. Following this, he starred in Pyaar Tune Kya Kiya and gained further popularity with his role in Yeh Rishtey Hain Pyaar Ke. Born on December 9, 1995, in Raipur, Chhattisgarh, Avinash has carved a niche for himself in the industry with his compelling performances and relatable personality, garnering a dedicated fanbase and making headlines for his work and philanthropic efforts. Avinash Mishra's journey in Bigg Boss 18 came to an unexpected end when he was asked to leave the house immediately following a heated physical altercation with fellow contestant Chum Darang. Incident Details The controversy began when Chum Darang allegedly used a derogatory term to address Avinash, sparking a fierce argument between the two contestants. The situation escalated rapidly, leading to a physical confrontation. Avinash Mishra has been subject to relationship rumors, particularly with his co-stars Vrushika Mehta and Kaveri Priyam. However, the actress later denied the claims and said in an interview, "That wasn’t true either, and I had clarified it back then. We shared great onscreen chemistry, and after working together for around two years, we became good friends. So, we used to spend time together and chill both on and off set. But some people just love creating stories about two co-actors." Avinash Mishra is a television actor who launched his acting career in 2017 with the series Sethji, where he portrayed the character Bajirao. That same year, he also appeared in Pyaar Tune Kya Kiya, alongside Jiya Shankar. Born on December 9, 1995, in Raipur, Chhattisgarh, Avinash has quickly made a name for himself in the television industry. Avinash Mishra's television career tookto another level with breakthrough role as Shantanu in the "Yeh Teri Galiyan" in 2018. The show, set in Kolkata's red-light district, explored themes of love, family, and social issues. Avinash's portrayal of Shantanu, a young and passionate character, earned him recognition and praise from audiences. His on-screen chemistry with co-star Vrushika Mehta was particularly appreciated. Avinash Mishra, who played the lead in Nath - Zevar Ya Zanjeer, bid adieu to the show. The actor had joined the show in February after Arjit Taneja quit. Avinash Mishra's stint in Nath - Zevar Ya Zanjeer came to an end, as he exited the show. He had taken on the lead role in February, replacing Arjit Taneja who had left the series at that time. During the Bigg Boss 18 promo, Chahat Pandey claimed that actors came and even left her show Nath, however, it was her who stayed all along. She further claimed that her producers call her the ‘hero’ of the show. The pleasing aroma of mehendi always calls for a celebration and is known to bring fortune, prosperity, and love. Applying mehendi on an auspicious occasion can also protect the wearer from evil. Mehendi designs are looked upon on the occasions of Indian festivals, pujas, and weddings. As we have the one-day Karwa Chauth fast around the corner, every married woman gets ready to apply the most beautiful mehendi and complete the look with stunning jewellery and a sari. As there are multiple mehendi designs and styles in the market, let’s choose from the best and draw some inspiration for the final look. Arabic mehendi style is one of the most popular types of mehendi designs which include an enchanting mix of floral and geometric patterns and create a statement look. While traditionally, the Indian designs cover our whole palm, Arabic designs are less intricate and cover the wrists and the back of our hands mainly. It has its roots in Persia, where soon the trend took all over the Arab countries and got its name. (Image Credits: Pinterest) Traditional Indian mehendi designs call for new beginnings or for an auspicious event. These designs consist of detailed meshwork patterns with flowers and intricate patterns that look beautiful and cover the whole palm and back of the hand. The Indian mehendi design got its inspiration from Egypt, and since the 4th century, henna designs were spotted in the Deccan regions in several caves which has become an important part of our culture.  (Image Credits: Pinterest) Bridal or jewellery mehendi designs applied on brides appear like jewellery which have intricate designs of flowers, petals, and leaves. Bridal mehendi designs mainly cover your full hands, arms, and legs, and hold a strong importance during wedding ceremonies. Many Indian brides also cover half of their legs and feet with intricate mehendi designs on their wedding grabbing the spotlight which makes them stand out of the crowd and look gorgeous on their wedding day. (Image Credits: Pinterest) The Moroccan mehendi style is mainly popular in the Middle East Gulf countries which look more simple and subtle but are very fine and properly laid. The style takes a more contemporary take and looks trendy, unique, and chic with small rounds and shapes that have intricate detailing around making your hands look subtle but stylish. The diamond-shaped mehendi design is very common in the Moroccan style and is their main feature.  (Image Credits: Pinterest) Originating from West Africa, mehendi designs were mainly ruled out by the ancient tribal communities and were inspired by their life events. African henna soon took over the world and is known as Lalle. Their drawings and designs are quite similar to the Arabic mehendi design and have enough space and gaps, unlike the Indian mehendi designs that are known for their intricate detailing. African designs also include a lot of tribal patterns that are related to their culture and come with bold borders and lines.  (Image Credits: Pinterest) Which mehendi design are you opting for this Karwa Chauth? content: Bollywood wives celebrate Karva Chauth at Anil and Sunita Kapoor’s house Sunita Kapoor, the wife of actor Anil Kapoor is celebrating Karva Chauth, and Bollywood wives are lining up at her house for the customary annual Karva Chauth pooja. Sunita earlier took to her Instagram and shared a picture of her hands adorned with Henna. Karva Chauth celebrations at the Kapoor house are a ritual for the industry people. Actress Shilpa Shetty, Raveena Tandon, Maheep Kapoor, Bhavana Pandey, Neelam Kothari, Mira Rajput, Lali Dhawan and her daughter-in-law Jaanvi Dhawan, Geeta Basra, Reema Jain and her daughter-in-law Anissa Malhotra Jain were snapped arriving at Anil Kapoor and Sunita Kapoor's house to observe Karwa Chauth rituals on Sunday Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak celebrated Karva Chauth with wife Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Cricketer Suresh Raina wishes all couples a Happy #KarvaChauth! Women perform rituals on the occasion of Karwa Chauth festival on defence colony flyover in Delhi. Photo By: Piyal Bhattacharjee Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan says, "It is an incredible festival...Our culture is incredible...My wife fasted for me today..." Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Raveena Tandon celebrates Karva Chauth with special wish for hubby Anil in Sanskrit Actress Raveena Tandon, who was recently seen in the streaming movie ‘Ghudchadi’, is celebrating Karva Chauth. On Sunday, the actress took to her Instagram, and shared an array of pictures in an Indian attire. In the pictures, the actress can be seen dressed in a beige coloured Anarkali suit which she paired with a red dupatta. She tied her hair neatly in a bun, and accessorised her look with statement jewellery. Raveena married film distributor Anil Thadani on February 22, 2004 in Jag Mandir Palace, Udaipur, Rajasthan according to Punjabi Khatri and Sindhi traditions. The actress gave birth to her daughter Rasha, in March 2005. In July 2008, she gave birth to her son Ranbirvardhan. Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Women break their fasts in Jaipur at moonrise Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Women perform rituals as they break their fast Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Vidisha Srivastava re-wears her wedding saree on Karva Chauth Actress Vidisha Srivastava, who essays the role of Anita Bhabi in the television show ‘Bhabiji Ghar Par Hai’, is all set to celebrate Karva Chauth with great excitement. The actress revealed that for the occasion, she will dress up as a bride by re-wearing the saree from her wedding day. The actress shared that she fasts every year on Karva Chauth, and often her husband also joins her in fasting. She said, “We started this tradition even before we got married. His love and devotion make me feel incredibly lucky. Sometimes, he even says, ‘You don’t need to fast, I’ll do it for you instead’. It is moments like these that make the day so special for us”. Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Rakul Preet Singh celebrates first Karva Chauth while on bed rest Actress Rakul Preet Singh, who is currently recuperating from a back injury, is celebrating her first Karva Chauth while on bed rest. On Sunday, she posted a video on her Instagram Stories, displaying her hands decorated with henna.  This year’s festivities hold added significance as it coincides with her mother-in-law’s birthday, bringing extra joy to the occasion. Recently married to actor-producer Jackky Bhagnani, Rakul is happily participating in the celebrations of Karva Chauth. The actress suffered a serious injury to her back earlier this month during her workout session when she engaged with an 80 kg deadlift. Aishwarya Sharma celebrates Karwa Chauth in style, shares stunning photos Actress Aishwarya Sharma, known for her role as Patralekha “Pakhi” in the popular romantic drama Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin, delighted fans by sharing a series of gorgeous pictures on social media in celebration of Karwa Chauth. In her latest post, Aishwarya dazzles in a vibrant red saree paired with elegant jewelry. Her hair cascades freely, accentuated by a beautiful mang tikka, enhancing her festive look. Accompanying the images, she wrote, “Happy Karwachauth,” alongside a moon and heart emojis, perfectly capturing the spirit of the occasion. Aishwarya’s husband, actor Neil Bhatt, also marked the festival by observing a fast for her. In a recent interview, he expressed the deeper meaning of Karwa Chauth for the couple. “For Aishwarya and me, Karva Chauth is more than just a ritual—it’s a celebration of our love and what we mean to each other,” he shared. He continued, “Each year, as we both observe the fast, we’re reminded of the strength we draw from one another. On Megha Barsenge’s set, we’re creating our own little festival of love. With all the bustle of filming, we’re doing our best to showcase devotion, laughter, and the magic that Karva Chauth brings to relationships. To all those celebrating this day, I wish you a day filled with love and togetherness.” Sonakshi Sinha is Karwa Chauth ready with exquisite mangalsutra Actress Sonakshi Sinha is marking her first Karwa Chauth on October 20, 2024, after marrying her longtime boyfriend Zaheer Iqbal on June 23. Known for her trendsetting fashion, Sonakshi is elevating her style this year with a remarkable mangalsutra that beautifully merges tradition and luxury. For this special occasion, she has chosen the exquisite Bvlgari Bvlgari Mangalsutra Sautoir Necklace, a creation from the renowned Roman high jeweler. This piece is crafted in 18 kt rose gold, infusing a touch of opulence while maintaining a connection to cultural heritage. Its modern elegance makes it a perfect accessory for the contemporary Indian woman. Notably, actress Priyanka Chopra Jonas also donned a Bvlgari mangalsutra for a photoshoot in 2021, highlighting its status as a fashion statement. Sonakshi’s decision to wear this exquisite piece is set to turn heads and capture attention during the festivities. The couple celebrated their union with a registered marriage followed by a star-studded wedding reception attended by Bollywood's elite. They shared their wedding joy on Instagram, reminiscing about their journey together: “On this very day, seven years back (23.06.2017), in each other's eyes, we saw love in its purest form and decided to hold on to it. Today, that love has guided us through all the challenges and triumphs, leading up to this moment, where, with the blessings of both our families and gods, we are now man and wife. Here’s to love, hope, and all things beautiful with each other, from now until forever.” Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Origin of this auspicious festival One of the oldest mentions of Karwa Chauth is in the Hindu epic 'Mahabharata'.The story of Queen Veervati, who once kept a fast for her husband, is a popularly associated with the festival. According to the story, Queen Veervati once observed a fast on Karwa Chauth to pray for her husband's longevity and good health. The word ‘Karwa’ means an earthen pot, and ‘Chauth’ means the fourth. To put the ‘Karwa’ in perspective, women offer ‘Argya’ to the moon using an earthen pot on the fourth day of Kartik month. Karwa Chauth is thus celebrated on the fourth day of Kartik in the Hindu lunar calendar, and according to the English calendar it falls anywhere between October and November. Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Breaking the Fast After the moon rituals, the husband offers his wife the first sip of water and a bite of food, which marks the official breaking of the fast. Many couples then enjoy a small meal together, often including traditional sweets and foods prepared for the occasion. Karwa Chauth 2024: Why women don’t directly view the moon rays on this auspicious day On Karwa Chauth, one of the most significant and unique rituals involves looking at the moon through a sieve rather than directly viewing its rays. This tradition is deeply rooted in symbolic beliefs, linking the moon’s rays to the well-being of married couples. According to ancient customs, the moon is believed to hold a special significance on this day, and its rays are said to have a profound influence, strengthening the bond between husband and wife. By viewing the moon through a sieve, women perform the ritual with respect, ensuring that both the moon and their marriage are protected from any negative influences. Additionally, the husband is often regarded as a symbol of the moon during this ritual. After gazing at the moon through the sieve, women traditionally look at their husbands the same way, reinforcing the sacred connection between the two. This practice emphasizes the importance of preserving sweetness, harmony, and love in their relationship. This ritual, though seemingly simple, carries layers of meaning, ensuring that the bond between married couples is safeguarded and nourished through faith and devotion on Karwa Chauth. Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Moon sighted in Ayodhya Karva Chauth 2024 Live: Shilpa Shetty shares video of Karwa Chauth puja Himachal Pradesh: Moon sighted in Shimla on Karwa Chauth, women perform rituals as they break their fast. Karva Chauth 2024: The timeless stories that define the festival’s spiritual significance Karva Chauth, celebrated by married women across India, is not just about fasting for a husband’s long life. It’s a day deeply rooted in tradition, love, and unwavering commitment. A central part of this celebration is the storytelling aspect, where age-old tales, or kathas, are passed down through generations, reinforcing the deeper spiritual meaning of the festival. In 2024, as women observe the fast and gather for the rituals, these timeless stories continue to inspire. Narratives such as the tale of Queen Veeravati, whose devotion and prayers brought her husband back to life, and the story of Savitri and Satyavan, symbolizing the triumph of love over fate, form the core of Karva Chauth’s spiritual teachings. These kathas encapsulate themes of faith, sacrifice, and resilience, connecting the physical act of fasting to the emotional and spiritual devotion women demonstrate for their husbands. Across different regions of India, these stories may vary, but their underlying message of marital strength and love remains the same. For many families, sharing these stories is more than a tradition—it’s a way to pass on cultural values, reminding future generations of the power of love, prayer, and devotion. Whether recited during the puja or read as a group, these tales continue to bind families and communities, making the celebration of Karva Chauth a truly meaningful experience. In this article, we explore some of the most popular Karva Chauth stories, giving insight into the mythology and folklore that have become integral to this sacred day, adding depth to the customs observed. Karwa Chauth 2024: Romantic tips for long-distance couples to celebrate together Karwa Chauth is a cherished festival that symbolizes love and devotion in marriage. While it's traditionally celebrated with the wife fasting and the husband helping her break the fast by offering water and sweets, long-distance couples may feel disheartened being apart on this special day. However, even from afar, the spirit of Karwa Chauth can be kept alive with a little creativity and effort. Here are some romantic ways long-distance couples can celebrate the day together: Create a cute montage video Take a trip down memory lane by compiling candid photos, goofy moments, and video clips of each other. Edit them into a heartwarming video or slideshow, adding cute animations. Share the video over a video call to relive those special moments and feel close, even miles apart. Send surprise gifts Surprise your partner with a thoughtful gift. Peek into their wish list or choose something personal, like a custom pendant, photo frame, or personalized coffee mug. Coordinate deliveries so they arrive in time for the special day, adding an element of surprise and connection. Host a virtual watch party Pick a favorite movie or series that resonates with your relationship and watch it together through a virtual watch party. Keep your cameras on to see each other's reactions or chat during your favorite scenes, making the experience more intimate and engaging. Celebrate the moon viewing ritual online One of the most important Karwa Chauth rituals involves viewing the moon through a sieve, followed by looking at the husband. You can perform this ritual online via video call. To make it extra special, surprise your partner with a delivery of sweets and snacks after breaking the fast. Having something physical to share, even if from afar, can create a sense of closeness. Share a post-fast feast together After the fast is broken, dress up in coordinated festive outfits and enjoy a meal together over a video call. For a more immersive experience, try cooking the same dishes. Sharing a meal, even virtually, makes the distance feel less significant. By using these thoughtful gestures, long-distance couples can celebrate Karwa Chauth with the same love and devotion, overcoming the physical distance to create lasting memories. Karwa Chauth 2024: Essential foods to break the fast After a full day of fasting, it's important to break the Karwa Chauth fast with gentle and nourishing foods. Anshul Singh, Team Leader of Clinical Nutrition & Dietetics at Artemis Hospitals, recommends foods that restore energy and hydration, ensuring a balanced recovery. Fruits Start with hydrating fruits like bananas, apples, or pomegranates. They provide natural sugars and a quick energy boost, making them an ideal first choice. Dairy products Dairy items such as sweetened milk, lassi, or paneer offer calcium and protein to replenish the body. These options help rehydrate and refresh after the fast. Nuts and seeds A small portion of nuts like almonds, cashews, or walnuts offers healthy fats and essential nutrients, making them a satisfying snack to break the fast. Khichdi or porridge Comforting foods like khichdi (rice and lentils) or porridge are easy to digest and provide a good balance of carbohydrates and proteins, ideal for restoring energy. These foods provide essential nourishment, ensuring a healthy and satisfying conclusion to the Karwa Chauth fast. title: South Africa vs New Zealand highlights, Women's T20 World Cup Final: New Zealand beat South Africa by 32 runs in final to win maiden title
content: Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: CHAMPIONS Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: THE KIWIS HAVE DONE IT! The night sky over Dubai erupts in a dazzling display of fireworks, celebrating a momentous occasion for New Zealand cricket.  The White Ferns, having previously fallen short in the 2009 and 2010 finals, have at last realized their long-held ambition and secured the coveted T20 World Cup title. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: NEW ZEALAND win T20 World Cup New Zealand beat South Africa by 32 runs in the final to win maiden Women's T20 World Cup title Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: BOWLED! BOWLED! Rosemary Mair castles Sinalo Jafta for 6 runs. New Zealand are just one wicket away from winning their maiden T20 World Cup trophy. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! SA 8 down! WICKET! Rosemary Mair takes her second wicket. Another one bites the dust. Full on middle and leg. Tryon hammers it down the ground but Green takes an easy catch.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! Kerr takes her third wicket! WICKET! Suzie Bates secures her third catch of the match, while Amelia Kerr claims her third wicket. The New Zealand Women's cricket team is in a commanding position and appears to be heading towards a victory. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! Luus gone! WICKET! Brooke Halliday dismisses Sune Luus for 8 runs. South Africa are 6 down now. Luus tries to smash but the ball hits the toe end of the bat. Suzie Bates takes an easy catch at short extra cover. New Zealand are celebrating. They are looking favourites from here.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Welcome boundary for SA! FOUR! The South African team, known as the Proteas, celebrated a much-needed boundary. The bowler delivered a full-length delivery with good pace, targeting the stumps. Chloe Tryon, the batter, timed her shot perfectly and executed a lofted drive over the bowler's head, resulting in a fantastic four runs. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! De Klerk goes! WICKET! Rosemary Mair strikes in her first delivery of the over. Nadine de Klerk falls for 6 runs.  The New Zealand Women's cricket team is exuding confidence, believing that victory is within their grasp. In a pivotal moment, Rosemary Mair delivers a strategically paced delivery, utilizing her skills to execute a traditional off-cutter that pitches outside the off-stump. De Klerk, the batsman, attempts to capitalize on the opportunity with a forceful swing, but the outcome is less than ideal. The bat makes contact with the ball, resulting in a substantial outside edge that propels the ball directly towards Kerr, positioned at short third. Kerr, alert and ready, secures the catch with ease, further solidifying New Zealand's advantageous position in the match. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! Kapp departs! WICKET! Eden Carson dismisses Marizanne Kapp for 8 runs. Big big wicket for New Zealand at the moment. Kapp has been dismissed, leaving her team in a precarious position with half of their lineup back in the pavilion. The wicket fell when Eden Carson delivered a full-length delivery outside the off stump. Kapp attempted to play an aggressive sweep shot, getting down on one knee and making good contact with the ball.  However, she failed to generate sufficient power behind the shot, resulting in a catch for Plimmer at deep mid-wicket, who made a commendable grab to her right. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! Anneke Bosch falls! WICKET! Melie Kerr and the New Zealand Women's team have struck a significant blow to South Africa's chances in the semifinal. Anneke Bosch, who had been instrumental with the bat for her team, has been dismissed. Kerr, employing a clever strategy, tossed the ball up and pitched it outside the off stump. Bosch, attempting to access the leg side, walked across to the off side and got down on one knee. However, she failed to make contact with the ball as she swiped across the line. Izzy Gaze, the wicketkeeper, and Kerr appealed for the wicket, but the umpire remained unmoved. Convinced of the dismissal, Gaze and Kerr persuaded their captain, Sophie Devine, to opt for a review. The UltraEdge technology revealed a faint spike when the ball passed the bat, confirming Bosch's departure and dealing a significant setback to South Africa's hopes in the crucial match. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! Wolvaardt falls! WICKET! Laura Wolvaardt, unable to withstand the mounting pressure from the opposition, attempted to break free from the constraints but unfortunately fell short. Kerr, despite her physical limitations, delivered a full-length delivery around the off-stump, enticing Wolvaardt to attempt an inside-out shot over the cover region. However, Wolvaardt's execution was flawed, as she failed to generate sufficient elevation on the shot, resulting in a flat and direct hit to the strategically placed fielder at extra cover. Suzie Bates, positioned within the ring, made no mistake in securing the catch near her chest, providing New Zealand with a crucial breakthrough. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! WICKET! Fran Jonas strikes, Tazmin Brits falls for 17 runs. Staying around the wicket, Jonas cleverly reduces her pace and maintains a persistent length targeting the middle stump. Tazmin Brits, the batter, attempts to seize the initiative by charging down the pitch, aiming for an aggressive shot. However, Brits misjudges the delivery and fails to reach the pitch of the ball. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: 50 comes up! 50 comes up for South Africa in just seventh over. Laura Wolvaardt and Tazmin Brits have given South Africa a flying start. This is the kind of start SA needed. Subscribe to our newsletter and get all the stories that matter delivered to your inbox Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Crunched! FOUR! Laura Wolvaardt smashes Rosemary Mair straight down the ground for a boundary. Loved the sound of the bat. Superb shot from her.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Laura Wolvaardt shifting gears! FOUR ! FOUR! Back to back boundaries for Laura Wolvaardt. The SA skipper is shifting gears now. Wolvaardt hits Lea Tahuhu for two consecutive boundaries. 10 runs off Lea Tahuhu's over.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Second boundary for Wolvaardt FOUR! Second boundary for Wolvaardt. The SA captain can't remain calm. She knows how to keep the run rate in place. She stays inside the crease, plays this through extra cover. What a timing.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: First FOUR! FOUR! First boundary for South Africa. Laura Wolvaardt smashes Eden Carson towards leg side. Superb stuff from her. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: 'Spin bowling is going to be key for us' Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Welcome back! Laura Wolvaardt and Tazmin Brits are in the middle. Rosemary Mair will open the attack for New Zealand. South Africa need 159 to win the title.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Innings break - REPORT Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Amelia Kerr, Brooke Halliday guide New Zealand to 158/5 against South Africa New Zealand Women conclude their innings with an impressive total!  The White Ferns will be delighted with this score, particularly considering the occasion of the final. Despite encountering difficulties during the middle overs, they successfully recovered the lost momentum. In the final 6 overs, New Zealand Women amassed an impressive 73 runs, propelling their total to a formidable 158. The innings began with New Zealand Women being asked to bat first. Georgia Plimmer wasted no time in setting the tone, striking a pair of boundaries in the opening over. While she was unable to capitalize on her strong start, Suzie Bates ensured that the scoring rate remained healthy throughout the Powerplay. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: NEW ZEALAND 158/5 in 20 overs vs SOUTH AFRICA Amelia Kerr (43), Brooke Halliday (38) guide New Zealand to 158/5 against South Africa Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: SIX! SIX! Maddy Green whacks Ayabonga Khaka between mid-wicket and long-on for  mammoth. What a shot. These are the valuable runs for New Zealand. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: 150 up for NZ 150 comes up for New Zealand. Maddy Green plays Ayabonga Khaka towards deep mid wicket. She takes a single and runs for another one. Brilliant running between the wickets. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! Amelia Kerr goes! WICKET! Nonkululeko Mlaba ends Amelia Kerr's stay at 43. A brilliant innings comes to an end. Nonkululeko Mlaba has struck a crucial blow for South Africa, dismissing Melie Kerr at a critical juncture in the match. The bowler maintained a disciplined line, targeting the stumps and pitching the ball on a good length in the off and middle stump region. Kerr, finding herself short on room, attempted to execute a pull shot towards the leg side from the back foot. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Two overs to go! Amelia Kerr key as New Zealand eye fighting total vs South Africa. Two overs to go in the innings. New Zealand eyeing a fighting total vs the Proteas Women. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! Halliday falls! WICKET! Chloe Tryon has delivered the much-needed breakthrough for the Proteas, leaving New Zealand Women four wickets down with the dismissal of Brooke Halliday. Tryon, maintaining her position around the stumps, bowled a flatter delivery on a good length, targeting the stumps. The ball skidded off the surface, reaching the batter quickly. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Another good over! Brooke Halliday and Amelia Kerr are batting well and dealing in boundaries at the moment. 40-run stand between the two batters so far. 13 runs off Nadine de Klerk's over.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: 100 comes up! Amelia Kerr plays De Klerk towards sweeper cover for a single. That's 100 up for New Zealand. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Another boundary! FOUR! Brooke Halliday hits another one. Consecutive fours. Superb placement from her. Poor fielding effort from de Klerk at long-on.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Lovely shot! FOUR! Brooke Halliday seems ready to got for a biggie. She picks the length and smashes Sune Luus for a boundary. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: REVIEW and OUT!  Nadine De Klerk's solitary appeal for an LBW decision was met with skepticism from her teammates. However, Laura Wolvaardt, after a brief discussion with Nadine, opted to review the decision with just a second remaining on the timer. The delivery, pitched on a challenging length and targeting the middle stump, caught Sophie Devine off guard as she attempted to pull the ball away. Devine, rushed in her shot, missed the ball entirely, which struck her on the back leg. The UltraEdge technology confirmed no contact with the bat, while Ball Tracking revealed three red lights, indicating that the ball would have hit the leg stump. Against all odds, South Africa managed to secure a crucial wicket in the first over after the break, dismissing the formidable Devine. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: DRINKS BREAK! The final has begun cautiously, with both teams satisfied with their current positions. New Zealand, dealing with the absence of Suzie Bates, finds themselves in a transitional phase. As Sophie Devine settles in and Melie Kerr adjusts to the pitch conditions, South Africa aims to maintain pressure on their opponents. The surface has presented challenges, with the ball occasionally sticking upon landing. Consequently, New Zealand must carefully evaluate their target score, considering the peculiarities of the pitch. Setting an overly ambitious goal could prove detrimental to their chances of success in this crucial match. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: STAT ATTACK This is the  (43/1) score against South Africa this tournament, surpassing Australia's 35/2 in the semifinal. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: WICKET! Bates falls! WICKET! Nonkululeko Mlaba gets the big wicket. She castles Suzie Bates for 32 runs. A flat and fast delivery. Bates gets inside the line and looks to paddle it away. She fails to connect the shot and the ball does the rest. Nonkululeko Mlaba exults in celebration. She knows she has got the big big success.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Highlights so far New Zealand started strong in the powerplay, reaching 50/1 after 7 overs, but South Africa's smart bowling kept them in check. Youngster Georgia Plimmer came out with intent, hitting a few early boundaries, but Ayabonga Khaka outfoxed her, leading to a catch at long-on.  Amelia Kerr responded aggressively, attacking from the first ball, though Marizanne Kapp tightened the grip with a controlled over, including bowling Kerr off a free-hit.  Suzie Bates regained momentum with a 10-run over but Chloe Tryon slowed things with a 2-run over. Nonkululeko Mlaba found turn, though Bates continued to play with positive intent. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: STAT ATTACK Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Excellent shot! FOUR! Suzie Bates is so strong at the leg side. Mlaba to Bates. The New Zealand batter shuffles across and smashes the ball towards deep square leg fence. That's the end of the Powerplay. 7 runs off Mlaba's over.  Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: STAT ATTACK New Zealand had lost just one wicket in the powerplay in this tournament heading into the final - against Australia - which happens to be their only defeat so far. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: Story behind Jersey No. 58 , has an intriguing story behind it. When she first played for the White Ferns, Georgia had a specific preference: she wanted a number that included an "8" to commemorate her birthday, which falls on February 8th.  However, due to the limited availability of jerseys at the time of her debut on August 6, 2022, the only option that met her criteria was the number 58. Women's T20 World Cup Final Live Score: FOUR for Bates! FOUR! A short of length delivery outside off from Ayabonga Khaka. Bates shuffles across and pulls this hard towards deep mid-wicket for a boundary. Superb shot from her. The highly anticipated 18th season of Bigg Boss is all set to introduce an exciting lineup of contestants, promising plenty of drama, entertainment, and surprises. From renowned TV celebrities to professionals like advocates, this season brings a diverse group of personalities under one roof, offering a fascinating mix of backgrounds and stories. After a gap of a year, Salman Khan returns as the host, adding his signature charm and wit to the show. Fans are eager to see how these contestants interact, compete, and form alliances in the house. As the new season kicks off, here’s a look at the confirmed list of participants who have entered the Bigg Boss 18 house. Shilpa Shirodkar, a popular Bollywood actress from the 90s, is all set to bring her star power to Bigg Boss 18. She made her Bollywood debut in 1989 with Ramesh Sippy’s Bhrashtachar, where she had the opportunity to work alongside iconic stars Mithun Chakraborty and Rekha. Shilpa quickly became a household name, starring in several successful films throughout the 90s, earning her a loyal fan base. In addition to her film career, Shilpa’s family ties also keep her in the spotlight—her elder sister, Namrata Shirodkar, is a former actress who is married to Telugu superstar Mahesh Babu. Shilpa’s entry into Bigg Boss 18 promises to bring nostalgia and excitement as she takes on the challenges of the reality show. Shehzada entered the TV Industry with the reality show 'Mujhse Shaadi Karogi' which had Shehnaaz Gill and Paras Chhabra. He then made his debut in acting with the TV show Yeh Jadu Hai Jinn Ka, the actor became a household name with his character Armaan in Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai but due to allegations of misconduct, Shehzada and his co-star Pratiksha Honmukhe were ousted from the show. Celebrity life coach and close friend of Hrithik Roshan, Arfeen Khan, has entered Bigg Boss 18. Known for his transformative coaching and motivational insights, Arfeen has worked with numerous high-profile clients, including Hrithik. His entry into the house brings a unique blend of wisdom and strategy, and fans are curious to see how his life-coaching skills will play out in the dynamic and unpredictable environment of the show. South Indian actress and comedian Shrutika Arjun Raaj has made her entry into Bigg Boss 18. Known for her impeccable comedic timing and captivating performances in the South Indian film industry, Shrutika is set to bring her charm and wit to the house. Fans are excited to see how her lively personality will add a unique flavor to the show this season. Vivian Dsena is a renowned actor in the Indian television industry, known for his captivating on-screen presence and heartthrob status. Over the years, he has been approached multiple times to join Bigg Boss, but only now has he decided to take the plunge into the reality show. Vivian has made headlines not just for his acting prowess but also for his personal life. He married Egyptian journalist Nouran Aly, keeping their relationship and marriage largely private for quite some time. The couple has a daughter named Layan. With his charismatic personality and loyal fan base, Vivian's entry into Bigg Boss 18 is highly anticipated, promising to add star power and intrigue to the show. Political leader Tajinder Bagga has also stepped into the Bigg Boss 18 house, adding a political flavor to the mix. Known for his outspoken views and active presence in the political arena, Bagga’s entry is expected to stir conversations and bring a new dimension to the show. Viewers are eager to see how he navigates the high-pressure environment of the house, blending politics with the drama of reality TV. Joining Arfeen Khan in Bigg Boss 18 is his wife, Sara Khan. The couple has entered the controversial reality show together, bringing both personal and professional dynamics to the forefront. While Arfeen is known for his life-coaching expertise, Sara’s presence adds an intriguing layer to their journey in the house. Fans are excited to see how the duo will handle the intense challenges and drama that the show is known for. The new promo of Bigg Boss 18 confirms that Advocate Gunaratna Sadavarte is all set to enter the house. It was reported that the Maharashtra and Goa Bar Council has suspended him. According to a report in ETimes, the State Bar Council suspended the lawyer's licence to practise for two years due to misbehaviour. The disciplinary committee found the advocate guilty of "other misconduct" under Section 35 of the Advocates Act of 1961. With the recent promo of the show, it was confirmed that Chahat Pandey will be entering the house. Chahat has appeared in several TV shows, including 'Tenali Rama', 'Hamari Bahu Silk', 'Laal Ishq', and 'Durga- Mata Ki Chhaya'. There had been a row of controversy due to actors of Humari Bahu Silk not receiving their dues for a long time. Chahat and her co-star Zaan Khan had come out and spoken about it. For the unversed, Chahat lost the recent assembly elections for the Aam Aadmi Party in Damoh, Madhya Pradesh. She received 2,292 votes, representing 1.22% of all votes cast. Jayant Malaiya, the BJP's candidate, won the election with 112,278 votes. Hema Sharma is commonly known as "Viral Bhabhi". She was chosen overnight for the reality show. Hema, who appeared in Dabangg 3, has become known as "Viral Bhabhi" for her engaging dancing videos, reels, and postings on numerous social media sites. Notably, in June 2023, Hema claimed she was physically assaulted by Salman Khan's security crew in 2019 when she attempted to see him and take a picture. This season will provide her with the opportunity to meet the superstar face-to-face. One of the TV's favourite bahus' Alice Kaushik will be entering the house. The actress became extremely popular with her show Pandya Store where she played the character of Raavi Pandya. Alice started her acting career with the mythological show Suryaputra Karn and later garnered immense praise for her grey character in Dipika Kakar and Karan V Grover starrer Kahaan Hum Kahaan Tum. During her stint with Pandya Store, Alice found love on the sets and later made it official that she had been dating Kanwar Dhillon. Rajat Dalal has officially entered the Bigg Boss 18 house, bringing with him a reputation for stirring controversies and an inspiring fitness journey. Known for his outspoken nature and bold opinions, Rajat has made headlines in the past, but he’s equally admired for his dedication to health and fitness. Fans are eager to see how his dynamic personality will shake things up in the house this season. Eisha Singh, known for her performances in prominent TV shows such as Ishq Subhan Allah, Sirf Tum, and Bekaaboo, has established herself in the industry. The actor was recently in the news for her close relationship with Bekaaboo co-star Shalin Bhanot. She was seen with Shalin at a couple of key events, which fuelled the link-up speculations. Eisha was there to applaud and support Shalin when he bought a new car or left for his Khatron Ke Khiladi 14 stint.  Muskan Bamne rose to fame with her portrayal of Pakhi in the highly popular TV show Anupamaa, where she became a household name. Her career began with a notable role in Shraddha Kapoor’s film Haseena Parkar, marking her entry into the entertainment industry. Muskan's role in Anupamaa brought her widespread recognition and a loyal fan base, but she decided to exit the show when it took a leap, as she was not keen on playing the role of a mother onscreen at such a young age. With her acting talent and strong screen presence, Muskan's entry into Bigg Boss 18 is sure to grab attention and keep viewers engaged. Muskan brought her entire family on the stage before entering the house.  Avinash Mishra is a well-established name in the Indian television industry, known for his versatile acting skills and impressive screen presence. The 29-year-old actor made his debut with the show Sethji in the role of Bajirao, which quickly earned him recognition. Over the years, Avinash has appeared in several popular TV shows, including Mariam Khan - Reporting Live, Yeh Rishtey Hain Pyaar Ke, Ishqbaaz, Titli, and most recently, Meetha Khatta Pyaar Humara. His diverse range of roles has showcased his talent and gained him a loyal fan base. Avinash’s entry into Bigg Boss 18 promises to bring both drama and charm to the house, keeping viewers intrigued. Avinash's eviction brings a new twist  Known for her unconventional roles on TV, Nyrraa Banerjii is set to enter the house with her intriguing flair. The actress was last seen in the stunt-based reality show Khatron Ke Khiladi's season 13. Nyyraa's constant struggle with water stunts was the highlight of her journey, however, the actress also shared a fun comic timing in the show and entertained her fans to the fullest. Her last fictional show on TV was Pishachini. Nyrraa is also a popular name in the southern Industry, as she has been a part of many Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada films.  Karan Veer Mehra made headlines by winning the 14th season of the popular stunt-based reality show Khatron Ke Khiladi, marking a major achievement in his career. Known for his daring attitude and adventurous spirit, Karan is now set to face a new challenge as he enters the Bigg Boss 18 house. Recently, his ongoing feud with Asim Riaz has been in the spotlight, with both exchanging sharp digs at each other through social media posts. While this rivalry has kept fans buzzing online, Karan’s journey in Bigg Boss is sure to bring its own share of excitement and drama, making him one of the most talked-about contestants this season. Chum Darang, known for her remarkable performances in films like Gangubai Kathiawadi and Badhaai Do, is all set to make her reality TV debut in Bigg Boss 18. She gained widespread recognition for her role in Badhaai Do, where she shared the screen with Bhumi Pednekar and Rajkummar Rao, playing Bhumi's love interest. The film garnered positive reviews for its progressive storyline, and Chum's portrayal stood out for its charm and authenticity. Beyond her acting career, Chum holds several titles from various beauty pageants, highlighting her versatility and achievements in multiple fields. Gadhraj being the 19th contestant has been evicted from the show in the first week. There have been many heated arguments between Chum and Avinash in the show. title: india business News
content: The Bombay Stock Exchange and National Stock Exchange in India will host a special 'Muhurat Trading' session on November 1, from 6 pm to 7 pm, marking Diwali and the new Samvat 2081. This one-hour trading window is seen as auspicious for financial prosperity. Market analysts predict volatility due to the brief session, emphasizing symbolic participation over profits. All India Consumer Products Distributors Federation urges the Competition Commission of India to probe Blinkit, Swiggy, and Zepto for alleged predatory pricing that challenges traditional retailers. Quick commerce platforms offering deep discounts and bypassing salespeople raised industry concerns; possible CCI investigation pending. The 'Industry 5.0 and AI report' by BML Munjal University reveals that 44% of organizations experienced productivity boosts through AI integration and 21% see AI as key for innovation. However, 34% face a shortage of AI-trained personnel, and ethical concerns require responsible AI governance.

Lawyer rams Mercedes car into Kachori shop in Delhi, Six injured In a shocking incident, six people were injured after a lawyer rammed his speeding Mercedes car into a Kachori shop in the national capital. The incident took place at Fateh Kachori in Civil Lines area. The police have taken the lawyer into custody and seized his car. The lawyer has been identified as Parag Maini who is a resident of Noida’s Sector 79.  The police have registered a case against the lawyer under Section 279 (rash driving) and 337 (causing hurt by endangering life). title: Vishing: Beware of this latest online scam technique | Cyber Crime
content: Hackers and cybercriminals are now using the latest online scam technique ‘vishing' to trap innocent people and steal their money. They use vishing or voice phishing along with OTP grabber services to manipulate users into revealing their one time passwords. To remain safe, users should regularly review bank & credit card statements & report any irregularities.#cybercrime #vishing #onlinescam

title: education News
content: The French government, in partnership with Campus France, launched the "Choose France Tour 2024" to showcase diverse academic opportunities in France for Indian students. Featuring over 50 prestigious institutions, the tour highlights career prospects with 600 French companies in India. Here’s how students can effectively master Social Science and ace their exams with these nine proven strategies. The CAT 2024, scheduled for November 24, includes three sections: Quantitative Ability (QA), Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension (VARC), and Data Interpretation and Logical Reasoning (DILR). The exam will be 120 minutes long with 66 questions, including both MCQs and non-MCQs. DILR will cover topics like bar graphs, blood relations, and syllogism. title: SPORTS NEWS
content: South Africa vs New Zealand Live Score, Women's T20 World Cup Final: South Africa were set a winning target of 159 runs against New Zealand in the Women’s T20 World Cup cricket final on Sunday that will produce a first-time champion.New Zealand scored 158-5 in 20 overs at Dubai International Cricket Stadium after South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt won the toss and opted to bowl.Amelia Kerr top scored for New Zealand with a 38-ball 43. Brooke Halliday hit 38 runs in 28 deliveries and opener Suzie Bates scored 32 in 31. Nonkululeko Mlaba took 2-31 in four overs for South Africa.Both teams fielded an unchanged side from their semifinal wins where South Africa stunned defending champions Australia in the first semi by eight wickets on Thursday, while New Zealand beat West Indies in the second semifinal by eight runs on Friday.This is South Africa’s second straight final appearance in the tournament. Losing to Australia by 19 runs, it had finished runners-up in its home tournament in 2023, its best result in the tournament.New Zealand, meanwhile, reached the tournament final for the first time since 2010. In the first two editions – 2009 and 2010 – they had lost to England by six wickets in London, and to Australia by three runs in Barbados. India's loss to New Zealand in the first Test in Bengaluru impacted their ICC World Test Championship points percentage, dropping it from 74.24 to 68.06. India remain on top but now faces closer competition from Australia and Sri Lanka for the WTC Final spot.

title: Cricket
content: Washington Sundar has been added to Team India's squad for the second and third Tests against New Zealand. Sundar, who excelled in the Ranji Trophy recently, will join the team in Pune for the match starting October 24. With seasoned spinners like Ashwin, Jadeja, and Kuldeep already in the squad, Sundar's inclusion might result in a change in combination. title: Business News
content: A group of state finance ministers is leaning towards exempting GST on term insurance plans and health insurance for seniors. They are also considering raising GST on luxury items like expensive watches and shoes to 28%, while reducing it for common-use goods like notebooks and bicycles. Kotak Mahindra Bank's net profit increased by 4.8% YoY to Rs 3,344 crore in Q2FY25 but decreased by 5% QoQ due to a one-time gain in the previous quarter. Gross deposits increased by 15.1% YoY, while gross advances grew by 17.4% YoY. Provisions rose to Rs 660 crore from Rs 366 crore YoY. Automobile exports from India surged 14% in April-September thanks to renewed demand in Latin America and Africa. Passenger vehicle exports climbed 12%, led by Maruti Suzuki, while two-wheeler exports jumped 16%. Yet, three-wheeler shipments experienced a slight decline. The industry's recovery follows challenges from currency devaluation and essential import prioritization last fiscal year. HDFC Bank's standalone net profit for Q2FY25 increased by 5% to Rs 16,821 crore, with total deposits rising by 15.06% YoY to Rs 25,00,100 crore. The bank's total income for the quarter reached Rs 85,500 crore, up from Rs 78,406 crore a year ago. Gross NPAs slightly increased to 1.36%, while net NPAs rose to 0.41%. title: WORLD NEWS
content: Kamala Harris is celebrating her 60th birthday amid a tight election contest with Donald Trump. Both candidates, along with their high-profile surrogates, are campaigning in key battleground states like Pennsylvania. Harris takes aim at Trump's mental fitness and hosts rallies with celebrities Lizzo and Usher, while Trump campaigns vigorously despite age concerns. Israeli airstrikes in northern Gaza resulted in at least 87 casualties, with additional injuries in Beit Lahiya. Israel's military continues operations targeting Hamas militants. The conflict has severely impacted Gaza's northern region, displacing many residents. Concurrently, the US is probing leaked documents on Israel's potential response plans to Iran's missile attack.
